channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: May 22, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
item.description: Spain, Norway and Ireland announced plans to formally recognize a Palestinian state, in a move that is likely to bolster the global Palestinian cause but strain relations with Israel.

item.title: Iran prepares to bury late president, foreign minister and others killed in crash
item.description: Iran is preparing to inter its late president at the holiest site for Shiite Muslims in the Islamic Republic, a final sign of respect for a protege of Iran’s supreme leader killed in a helicopter crash earlier this week

item.title: UK PM announces general election
item.description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has called a snap general election for July 4.

item.title: A closer look at Trump's vow to deport millions of migrants illegally living in US
item.description: Central to Donald Trump's run for president is a dark pledge to deport millions of migrants illegally living in the U.S. if elected.

item.title: May 21, 2024 Israel-Hamas war, Iran president death news
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu blasted the charges brought by the International Criminal Court against himself and Israel's defense minister as "beyond outrageous" in an interview Tuesday with CNN's Jake Tapper.

item.title: Toronto awarded WNBA's first franchise outside US, set to begin play in 2026
item.description: Toronto has been awarded the WNBA’s first franchise outside the United States, with the expansion team set to begin play in 2026

item.title: Both sides rest cases without Trump testifying in hush money trial
item.description: Donald Trump's New York criminal hush money trial has adjourned until next Tuesday, when closing arguments are expected to take place.

item.title: UNRWA suspends aid to Rafah due to 'insecurity, lack of supplies' amid ongoing war
item.description: UNRWA said Tuesday it has suspended aid deliveries to Rafah due to "insecurity" and "lack of supplies" amid the ongoing Israel-Hamas war.

item.title: The latest on Singapore Airlines turbulence incident
item.description: One person has died and at least 71 others were injured on board a Singapore Airlines plane that encountered severe turbulence on a flight from London to Singapore. Follow for live updates.

item.title: Ex-top prosecutor for Baltimore to be sentenced for mortgage fraud and perjury convictions
item.description: A former top prosecutor for the city of Baltimore is to be sentenced this week for lying about her finances to improperly access retirement funds during the COVID-19 pandemic
